title: ISO burnt to DVD won't boot

forumNotes.author: TheFog
forumNotes.content:
This is probably very simple to fix but I have spent several hours trying to solve my problem but can't.

Hope someone can help please.

I have used SARDU to make a multiboot ISO to burn to DVD. I have added some extra progs to the menu and the final build works fine from QEMU. However, I wanted to customise the menu for personal easier navigation. So I extracted all files and folders from the ISO and then updated the isolinux.cfg menu file. Then I used IMGBURN to re-make the ISO but the ISO isn't bootable either in QEMU of from a DVD. I understand that in IMGBURN there is an advanced tab in the ISO build mode and under the advanced tab there is an option to make a bootable ISO but I just don't understand if this is what I must use.

There is nothing incorrect with my updated isolinux.cfg file as I have checked that it works by using the same changes with the syslinux.cfg file from a USB build.

forumNotes.author: Sha0
forumNotes.content:
> Hope someone can help please.
**Syslinux** documents how to build an **.ISO** with **mkisofs** in **doc/isolinux.txt** . I don't know about "IMGBURN".

forumNotes.author: ady
forumNotes.content:
> I understand that in IMGBURN there is an advanced tab in the ISO build mode and under the advanced tab there is an option to make a bootable ISO but I just don't understand if this is what I must use.

You probably need at least Joliet in addition to ISO9660, AND the advanced -\> Bootable Disc section too. Check "Make Image Bootable" and "Patch Boot Information Table" and then in "Boot Image:" select the folder where you have the extracted files (that would be part of the ISO image you want to build) and search in those folders for the "isolinux.bin" file. That's the expected "Boot Image". Without it, your ISO won't boot.  

All this info is already included in the IMGBURN guides.
